name: Ext.grid.feature.Grouping
doc:
This feature allows to display the grid rows aggregated into groups as specified by the grouper specified on the Store. The group will show the title for the group name and then the appropriate records for the group underneath. The groups can also be expanded and collapsed.

Extra Events

This feature adds several extra events that will be fired on the grid to interact with the groups:

  • groupclick
  • groupdblclick
  • groupcontextmenu
  • groupexpand
  • groupcollapse

Menu Augmentation

This feature adds extra options to the grid column menu to provide the user with functionality to modify the grouping. This can be disabled by setting the enableGroupingMenu option. The option to disallow grouping from being turned off by the user is enableNoGroups.

Controlling Group Text

The groupHeaderTpl is used to control the rendered title for each group. It can modified to customized the default display.

Example Usage

var store = Ext.create('Ext.data.Store', {
    storeId:'employeeStore',
    fields:['name', 'seniority', 'department'],
    groupField: 'department',
    data: {'employees':[
        { "name": "Michael Scott",  "seniority": 7, "department": "Management" },
        { "name": "Dwight Schrute", "seniority": 2, "department": "Sales" },
        { "name": "Jim Halpert",    "seniority": 3, "department": "Sales" },
        { "name": "Kevin Malone",   "seniority": 4, "department": "Accounting" },
        { "name": "Angela Martin",  "seniority": 5, "department": "Accounting" }
    ]},
    proxy: {
        type: 'memory',
        reader: {
            type: 'json',
            rootProperty: 'employees'
        }
    }
});

Ext.create('Ext.grid.Panel', {
    title: 'Employees',
    store: Ext.data.StoreManager.lookup('employeeStore'),
    columns: [
        { text: 'Name',     dataIndex: 'name' },
        { text: 'Seniority', dataIndex: 'seniority' }
    ],
    features: [{ftype:'grouping'}],
    width: 200,
    height: 275,
    renderTo: Ext.getBody()
});

Note: To use grouping with a grid that has locked columns, you need to supply the grouping feature as a config object - so the grid can create two instances of the grouping feature.

members.name: collapsible
members.doc:
Set to false to disable collapsing groups from the UI.

This is set to false when the associated store is a BufferedStore.
members.short_doc: Set to false to disable collapsing groups from the UI. ...

members.name: depthToIndent
members.doc: Number of pixels to indent per grouping level
members.short_doc: Number of pixels to indent per grouping level ...

members.name: enableGroupingMenu
members.doc: True to enable the grouping control in the header menu.
members.short_doc: True to enable the grouping control in the header menu. ...

members.name: enableNoGroups
members.doc: True to allow the user to turn off grouping.
members.short_doc: True to allow the user to turn off grouping. ...

members.name: groupByText
members.doc: Text displayed in the grid header menu for grouping by header.
members.short_doc: Text displayed in the grid header menu for grouping by header. ...

members.name: groupHeaderTpl
members.doc:
A string Template snippet, an array of strings (optionally followed by an object containing Template methods) to be used to construct a Template, or a Template instance.

  • Example 1 (Template snippet):

    groupHeaderTpl: 'Group: {name}'

  • Example 2 (Array):

    groupHeaderTpl: [
    'Group: ',
    '<div>{name:this.formatName}</div>',
    {
        formatName: function(name) {
            return Ext.String.trim(name);
        }
    }
]

  • Example 3 (Template Instance):

    groupHeaderTpl: Ext.create('Ext.XTemplate',
    'Group: ',
    '<div>{name:this.formatName}</div>',
    {
        formatName: function(name) {
            return Ext.String.trim(name);
        }
    }
)

properties.name: columnName
properties.doc: The column header associated with the field being grouped by if there is a column for the field, falls back to the groupField name.

properties.name: groupValue
properties.doc: The value of the groupField for the group header being rendered.

properties.name: renderedGroupValue
properties.doc: The rendered value of the groupField for the group header being rendered, as produced by the column renderer.

properties.name: rows
properties.doc: Deprecated - use children instead. An array containing the child records for the group being rendered. Not available if the store is a BufferedStore

properties.name: children
properties.doc: An array containing the child records for the group being rendered. Not available if the store is a BufferedStore

members.short_doc: A string Template snippet, an array of strings (optionally followed by an object containing Template methods) to be u...

members.name: hideGroupedHeader
members.doc: True to hide the header that is currently grouped.
members.short_doc: True to hide the header that is currently grouped. ...

members.name: remoteRoot
members.doc: The name of the property which contains the Array of summary objects. It allows to use server-side calculated summaries.
members.short_doc: The name of the property which contains the Array of summary objects. ...

members.name: showGroupsText
members.doc: Text displayed in the grid header for enabling/disabling grouping.
members.short_doc: Text displayed in the grid header for enabling/disabling grouping. ...

members.name: startCollapsed
members.short_doc: True to start all groups collapsed. ...

members.name: collapseTip
members.default: 'Click to collapse. CTRL/click collapses all others'

members.name: disabled
members.short_doc: True when feature is disabled. ...

members.name: eventPrefix
members.doc: Prefix to use when firing events on the view. For example a prefix of group would expose "groupclick", "groupcontextmenu", "groupdblclick".
members.short_doc: Prefix to use when firing events on the view. ...

members.name: eventSelector
members.doc: Selector used to determine when to fire the event with the eventPrefix.
members.short_doc: Selector used to determine when to fire the event with the eventPrefix. ...

members.name: expandTip
members.default: 'Click to expand. CTRL key collapses all others'

members.name: hasFeatureEvent
members.doc: Most features will expose additional events, some may not and will need to change this to false.
members.short_doc:
Most features will expose additional events, some may not and will

members.name: isFeature
members.doc: true in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Feature, or subclass thereof.
members.short_doc: true in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Feature, or subclass thereof. ...

members.name: outerTpl
members.default: ['{%', 'if (!(this.groupingFeature.disabled || values.rows.length === 1 && values.rows[0].isSummary)) {', 'this.groupingFeature.setup(values.rows, values.view.rowValues);', '}', 'this.nextTpl.applyOut(values, out, parent);', 'if (!(this.groupingFeature.disabled || values.rows.length === 1 && values.rows[0].isSummary)) {', 'this.groupingFeature.cleanup(values.rows, values.view.rowValues);', '}', '%}', {priority: 200}]

members.name: summaryRowTpl
members.doc: High priority rowTpl interceptor which sees summary rows early, and renders them correctly and then aborts the row rendering chain. This will only see action when summary rows are being updated and Table.onUpdate->Table.bufferRender renders the individual updated sumary row.
members.short_doc: High priority rowTpl interceptor which sees summary rows early, and renders them correctly and then aborts the row re...

members.name: generateSummaryData
members.doc:
Used by the Grouping Feature when showSummaryRow is true.

Generates group summary data for the whole store.

return.name: return
return.doc: An object hash keyed by group name containing summary records.

members.short_doc: Used by the Grouping Feature when showSummaryRow is true. ...

members.name: getFireEventArgs
members.doc:
Abstract method to be overriden when a feature should add additional arguments to its event signature. By default the event will fire:

  • view - The underlying Ext.view.Table
  • featureTarget - The matched element by the defined eventSelector

The method must also return the eventName as the first index of the array to be passed to fireEvent.
members.short_doc:
Abstract method to be overriden when a feature should add additional
arguments to its event signature. ...

members.name: getMenuItem
members.doc: Gets the related menu item for a dataIndex
members.short_doc: Gets the related menu item for a dataIndex ...

members.name: getRecordGroup
members.doc: Returns the group data object for the group to which the passed record belongs if the Store is grouped.

params.name: record
params.doc: The record for which to return group information.

return.name: return
return.doc: A single group data block as returned from Store.getGroups. Returns undefined if the Store is not grouped.

members.short_doc: Returns the group data object for the group to which the passed record belongs if the Store is grouped. ...

members.name: getSummary
members.doc: Get the summary data for a field.

params.name: store
params.doc: The store to get the data from

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of aggregation. If a function is specified it will be passed to the stores aggregate function.

return.name: return
return.doc: See the return type for the store functions. if the group parameter is true An object is returned with a property named for each group who's value is the summary value.

members.short_doc: Get the summary data for a field. ...

members.name: init
members.doc: Listen for store updates. Eg, from an Editor.
members.short_doc: Listen for store updates. ...

members.name: isExpanded
members.doc: Returns true if the named group is expanded.

params.name: groupName
params.doc: The group name. This is the value of the groupField.

return.name: return
return.doc: true if the group defined by that value is expanded.

members.short_doc: Returns true if the named group is expanded. ...

members.name: onColumnMove
members.doc: Update first and last records in groups when column moves Because of the RowWrap template, this will update the groups' headers and footers
